meanings.sent1: He was fobbing his friend by pretending to have lost the money.
meanings.sent2: She caught him fobbing her with a fake promise.
meanings.sent3: The magician was fobbing the audience with his sleight of hand tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her smile fobbed him into believing her lies.
meanings.sent5: The con artist was fobbing unsuspecting victims out of their savings.

meanings.definition: To put off or evade (a task or responsibility).
meanings.sent1: He kept fobbing off his homework by playing video games.
meanings.sent2: She was fobbing off the difficult conversation with her boss.
meanings.sent3: The student tried fobbing off the deadline by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent4: Procrastination only leads to fobbing off important duties.
meanings.sent5: Avoiding work by fobbing off tasks will only cause trouble later.

meanings.definition: To trick or deceive someone by giving false excuses.
meanings.sent1: She was fobbing her parents with excuses about being late.
meanings.sent2: He tried fobbing the teacher with a story about his missing homework.
meanings.sent3: The child was fobbing his way out of trouble with creative tales.
meanings.sent4: Fobbing your way out of trouble only leads to more problems.
meanings.sent5: The salesman was fobbing customers with false promises of easy solutions.
